name: Alchemist
description: Alchemists specialize in blending magical reagents to create powerful elixirs. Their creations can restore life, enhance allies, or deliver volatile elemental effects.

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist’s supplies. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

3.name: Alchemist Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

3.name: Experimental Elixir
3.description: At 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce an experimental elixir in an empty flask you touch. The elixir’s effect is determined by rolling on the Experimental Elixir table. You can also create specific elixirs by expending spell slots. Any elixir you create lasts until it is consumed or until the end of your next long rest.

rows.effect: Healing. The drinker regains hit points equal to 2d4 + your Intelligence modifier.
Swiftness. The drinker’s walking speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.
Resilience. The drinker gains a +1 bonus to AC for 10 minutes.
Boldness. For 1 minute, the drinker can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to every attack roll and saving throw they make.
Flight. The drinker gains a flying speed of 10 feet for 10 minutes.
Transformation. The drinker’s body is transformed as if by the alter self spell for 10 minutes.

5.name: Alchemical Savant
5.description: Beginning at 5th level, when you cast a spell using your alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell equal to your Intelligence modifier. This bonus applies to acid, poison, fire, or necrotic damage, or to healing provided by the spell.

9.name: Restorative Reagents
9.description: Starting at 9th level, experimental elixirs you create provide additional restorative benefits. The drinker gains temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier. In addition, you can cast lesser restoration without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus.

15.name: Chemical Mastery
15.description: At 15th level, you gain resistance to acid damage and poison damage, and you are immune to the poisoned condition. In addition, you can cast greater restoration and heal once without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use alchemist’s supplies as the spellcasting focus.
